content: It's about time the Republicans learned how to play the new game in Congress. Add an unrelated amendment to a piece of legislation that the administration wants passed quickly. It forces the hand of the opposition to either keep their timeline with the amendment in place or take the time to rewrite or veto the bill. It is a tactic that the Dems have being using for years.
reply: It's about time the Republicans learned how to play the new game in Congress. Add an unrelated amendment to a piece of legislation that the administration wants passed quickly. It forces the hand of the opposition to either keep their timeline with the amendment in place or take the time to rewrite or veto the bill. It is a tactic that the Dems have being using for years.
title: Obama Signs Bill Allowing Loaded Concealed Guns in National Parks

Add an unrelated amendment to a piece of legislation that the administration wants passed quickly. content: quote: Originally posted by jack_flats: Again ... A law not even passed during a Republican Adminstration, you know, the NRA darlngs, Bush-Cheney???? Another radical right-wing myth debunked ... lol quote: In a stinging defeat for gun-control advocates, Congress has voted to allow people to carry loaded guns in national parks and wildlife refuges. The House approved the measure, 279-147, on Wednesday, one day after the Senate acted. content: It's about time the Republicans learned how to play the new game in Congress. Add an unrelated amendment to a piece of legislation that the administration wants passed quickly. It forces the hand of the opposition to either keep their timeline with the amendment in place or take the time to rewrite or veto the bill. It is a tactic that the Dems have being using for years.
reply: It's about time the Republicans learned how to play the new game in Congress. Add an unrelated amendment to a piece of legislation that the administration wants passed quickly. It forces the hand of the opposition to either keep their timeline with the amendment in place or take the time to rewrite or veto the bill. It is a tactic that the Dems have being using for years.

reply: They may not have needed "widespread" republican support, but it's in there for a reason. Maybe to get it to pass sooner?
title: Obama Signs Bill Allowing Loaded Concealed Guns in National Parks

content: quote: Originally posted by rayld2: quote: Originally posted by karlhungusjr: quote: Read the article again. Congressional supportors of the 2nd ammendment tacked it on. yes. I understand that. I didn't think gun control advocates tacked it on. who put it in is unimportant. the fact is it easily could have been removed and it wasn't. It easily could have been vetoed and it won't. why? because the democrats aren't the evil gun grabbers the NRA makes them out to be. I EXPECTED this to be removed in conference (combin senate and house versions) since after conference only an up or down vote is taken requiring only a simple majority of votes to pass. The Demos could have easily removed the it and still passed the Credit card bill. quote: Democratic leaders decided not to remove the gun provision after Sen. Tom Coburn, R-Okla., was able to insert it into a popular bill imposing new restrictions on credit card companies. Lawmakers and aides said there was not enough time to send the bill to a House-Senate conference committee _ where it could be removed without a vote _ and still get it to President Barack Obama by Memorial Day as he has requested. "http://www.newser.com/article/d98a78n00/congress-votes-to-restore-bush-policy-allowing-loaded-guns-in-national-parks-wildlife-refuges.html"

Lawmakers and aides said there was not enough time to send the bill to a House-Senate conference committee _ where it could be removed without a vote _ and still get it to President Barack Obama by Memorial Day as he has requested. "http://www.newser.com/article/d98a78n00/congress-votes-to-restore-bush-policy-allowing-loaded-guns-in-national-parks-wildlife-refuges.html"

content: quote: Originally posted by jack_flats: Again ... A law not even passed during a Republican Adminstration, you know, the NRA darlngs, Bush-Cheney???? Another radical right-wing myth debunked ... lol quote: In a stinging defeat for gun-control advocates, Congress has voted to allow people to carry loaded guns in national parks and wildlife refuges. The House approved the measure, 279-147, on Wednesday, one day after the Senate acted. A total of 105 Democrats in the House joined 174 Republicans in supporting the gun measure, which essentially restores a Bush administration policy that allowed loaded guns in national parks for two months earlier this year. "http://www.newser.com/article/d98a78n00/congress-votes-to-restore-bush-policy-allowing-loaded-guns-in-national-parks-wildlife-refuges.html"
